first_half: The fear of the Lord is the beginning of knowledge:
second_half: but fools despise wisdom and instruction.

first_half: Trust in the Lord with all thine heart;
second_half: and lean not unto thine own understanding.

first_half: In all thy ways acknowledge him,
second_half: and he shall direct thy paths.

first_half: Be not wise in thine own eyes:
second_half: fear the Lord, and depart from evil.

first_half: Happy is the man that findeth wisdom,
second_half: and the man that getteth understanding.

first_half: For the gaining of wisdom is better than silver,
second_half: and the profit thereof than fine gold.

first_half: Wisdom is the principal thing; therefore get wisdom:
second_half: and with all thy getting get understanding.

first_half: Keep thy heart with all diligence;
second_half: for out of it are the issues of life.

first_half: Go to the ant, thou sluggard;
second_half: consider her ways, and be wise.

first_half: The fear of the Lord is to hate evil:
second_half: pride, and arrogancy, and the evil way, and the froward mouth, do I hate.

first_half: Give instruction to a wise man, and he will be yet wiser:
second_half: teach a just man, and he will increase in learning.

first_half: The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom:
second_half: and the knowledge of the holy is understanding.

first_half: A wise son maketh a glad father:
second_half: but a foolish son is the heaviness of his mother.

first_half: Treasures of wickedness profit nothing:
second_half: but righteousness delivereth from death.

first_half: He that gathereth in summer is a wise son:
second_half: but he that sleepeth in harvest is a son that causeth shame.

first_half: The memory of the just is blessed:
second_half: but the name of the wicked shall rot.

first_half: He that walketh uprightly walketh surely:
second_half: but he that perverteth his ways shall be known.

first_half: Hatred stirreth up strifes:
second_half: but love covereth all sins.

first_half: In the multitude of words there wanteth not sin:
second_half: but he that refraineth his lips is wise.

first_half: The blessing of the Lord, it maketh rich,
second_half: and he addeth no sorrow with it.

first_half: Where no counsel is, the people fall:
second_half: but in the multitude of counsellors there is safety.

first_half: The liberal soul shall be made fat:
second_half: and he that watereth shall be watered also himself.

first_half: He that troubleth his own house shall inherit the wind:
second_half: and the fool shall be servant to the wise of heart.

first_half: A righteous man regardeth the life of his beast:
second_half: but the tender mercies of the wicked are cruel.

first_half: He that is slow to wrath is of great understanding:
second_half: but he that is hasty of spirit exalteth folly.

first_half: A soft answer turneth away wrath:
second_half: but grievous words stir up anger.

first_half: The eyes of the Lord are in every place,
second_half: beholding the evil and the good.

first_half: A wholesome tongue is a tree of life:
second_half: but perverseness therein is a breach in the spirit.

first_half: Better is little with the fear of the Lord
second_half: than great treasure and trouble therewith.

first_half: A man hath joy by the answer of his mouth:
second_half: and a word spoken in due season, how good is it!

first_half: Commit thy works unto the Lord,
second_half: and thy thoughts shall be established.

first_half: When a man's ways please the Lord,
second_half: he maketh even his enemies to be at peace with him.

first_half: A man's heart deviseth his way:
second_half: but the Lord directeth his steps.

first_half: Pride goeth before destruction,
second_half: and an haughty spirit before a fall.

first_half: Pleasant words are as an honeycomb,
second_half: sweet to the soul, and health to the bones.

first_half: He that is slow to anger is better than the mighty;
second_half: and he that ruleth his spirit than he that taketh a city.

first_half: A friend loveth at all times,
second_half: and a brother is born for adversity.

first_half: A merry heart doeth good like a medicine:
second_half: but a broken spirit drieth the bones.

first_half: Even a fool, when he holdeth his peace, is counted wise:
second_half: and he that shutteth his lips is esteemed a man of understanding.

first_half: The name of the Lord is a strong tower:
second_half: the righteous runneth into it, and is safe.

first_half: A man's gift maketh room for him,
second_half: and bringeth him before great men.

first_half: Death and life are in the power of the tongue:
second_half: and they that love it shall eat the fruit thereof.

first_half: Whoso findeth a wife findeth a good thing,
second_half: and obtaineth favor of the Lord.

first_half: Hear counsel, and receive instruction,
second_half: that thou mayest be wise in thy latter end.

first_half: There are many devices in a man's heart;
second_half: nevertheless the counsel of the Lord, that shall stand.

first_half: Wine is a mocker, strong drink is raging:
second_half: and whosoever is deceived thereby is not wise.

first_half: The hearing ear, and the seeing eye,
second_half: the Lord hath made even both of them.

first_half: The king's heart is in the hand of the Lord, as the rivers of water:
second_half: he turneth it whithersoever he will.

first_half: A good name is rather to be chosen than great riches,
second_half: and loving favor rather than silver and gold.

first_half: Train up a child in the way he should go:
second_half: and when he is old, he will not depart from it.

first_half: The borrower is servant to the lender.
second_half: Proverbs 22:7

first_half: Remove not the ancient landmark,
second_half: which thy fathers have set.

first_half: As he thinketh in his heart, so is he:
second_half: Eat and drink, saith he to thee; but his heart is not with thee.

first_half: If thine enemy be hungry, give him bread to eat;
second_half: and if he be thirsty, give him water to drink.

first_half: Answer not a fool according to his folly,
second_half: lest thou also be like unto him.

first_half: As a dog returneth to his vomit,
second_half: so a fool returneth to his folly.

first_half: Boast not thyself of to morrow;
second_half: for thou knowest not what a day may bring forth.

first_half: Iron sharpeneth iron;
second_half: so a man sharpeneth the countenance of his friend.

first_half: The wicked flee when no man pursueth:
second_half: but the righteous are bold as a lion.

first_half: He that covereth his sins shall not prosper:
second_half: but whoso confesseth and forsaketh them shall have mercy.
